perturbation.original_text: "End User Agreement" means Supp l i e r ' s s t andard l i cense ag reement s , wh ich a re ava i l ab le a t https://walabot.com/walabot-home, which governs each End User's right to use the Product, as amended by Supplier in its sole discretion from time to time.
perturbation.changed_text: "End User Agreement" means Supplier's standard license agreements, which are available at https://walabot.com/walabot-home, which governs each End User's right to use the Product. The Supplier shall seek Reseller's approval on the End User Agreement and no change shall come into effect without written approval from the Reseller.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows the Supplier to amend the End User Agreement in its sole discretion. The modified text requires the Supplier to seek Reseller's approval, creating a contradiction and uncertainty about who has the authority to modify the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: Appointment During the Term (defined below) and subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement (including, but not limited to Section 12.4 hereof), Supplier hereby (i) appoints Reseller, and Reseller accepts the appointment, as a non‚Äê exclusive reseller of the Products in the Territory.
perturbation.changed_text: Appointment During the Term (defined below) and subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Supplier hereby (i) appoints Reseller, and Reseller accepts the appointment, as an exclusive reseller of the Products in the Territory. Supplier reserves the right to appoint other resellers upon written consent from the Reseller.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the Reseller is appointed as a non-exclusive reseller. The modified text appoints the Reseller as an exclusive reseller but also provides for Supplier to appoint other resellers upon consent from the Reseller. This contradicts the meaning of exclusive, creating uncertainty. It is now unclear if the reseller is exclusive or only has priority.

perturbation.original_text: Following the Initial Term, either Party may terminate this Agreement without cause upon written notice to the other Party of at least 3 months.
perturbation.changed_text: Following the Initial Term, either Party may terminate this Agreement without cause upon written notice to the other Party of at least 3 months. However, termination by the Reseller requires demonstration of a breach from the Supplier as determined solely by the Supplier.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that either party can terminate the agreement without cause. The modified text adds a condition that the Reseller can only terminate if there is a breach and that the supplier should determine that this is a breach. This change puts a condition to the Reseller's termination process which is a conflict from the original section.
